breadcrumbs.description: List of breadcrumbs recorded before this event.

contexts.description: Contexts describing the environment (e.g. device, os or browser).

debug_meta.description: Meta data for event processing and debugging.

environment.description: Environment the environment was generated in ("production" or "development").

errors.description: Errors encountered during processing. Intended to be phased out in favor of annotation/metadata system.

extra.description: Arbitrary extra information set by the user.

key_id.description: Project key which sent this event.

logentry.description: Custom parameterized message for this event.

modules.description: Name and versions of installed modules.

platform.description: Platform identifier of this event (defaults to "other").

received.description: Timestamp when the event has been received by Sentry.

request.description: Information about a web request that occurred during the event.

sdk.description: Information about the Sentry SDK that generated this event.

server_name.description: Server or device name the event was generated on.

stacktrace.description:
Event stacktrace.

DEPRECATED: Prefer `threads` or `exception` depending on which is more appropriate.

start_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the event has started (relevant for event type = "transaction")

threads.description: Threads that were active when the event occurred.

time_spent.description: Time since the start of the transaction until the error occurred.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when the event was created.

type.description: Type of event: error, csp, default

user.description: Information about the user who triggered this event.

app_build.description: Internal build ID as it appears on the platform.

app_name.description: Application name as it appears on the platform.

app_version.description: Application version as it appears on the platform.

device_app_hash.description: Device app hash (app specific device ID)

image_addr.description: Starting memory address of the image (required).

image_size.description: Size of the image in bytes (required).

name.description: Path and name of the debug image (required).

uuid.description: The unique UUID of the image.

category.description: The optional category of the breadcrumb.

data.description: Custom user-defined data of this breadcrumb.

message.description: Human readable message for the breadcrumb.

name.description: Optional name of the errno constant.

number.description: The error code as specified by ISO C99, POSIX.1-2001 or POSIX.1-2008.

client_ip.description: IP Address of sender??? Seems unused.

integrations.description: List of integrations that are enabled in the SDK.

packages.description: List of installed and loaded SDK packages.

images.description: List of debug information files (debug images).

sdk_info.description: Information about the system SDK (e.g. iOS SDK).

arch.description: Native cpu architecture of the device.

boot_time.description: Indicator when the device was booted.

charging.description: Whether the device was charging or not.

external_free_storage.description: Free size of the attached external storage in bytes (eg: android SDK card).

external_storage_size.description: Total size of the attached external storage in bytes (eg: android SDK card).

free_memory.description: How much memory is still available in bytes.

free_storage.description: How much storage is free in bytes.

low_memory.description: Whether the device was low on memory.

online.description: Whether the device was online or not.

storage_size.description: Total storage size of the device in bytes.

usable_memory.description: How much memory is usable for the app in bytes.

value.description: The original value causing this error.

mechanism.description: Mechanism by which this exception was generated and handled.

stacktrace.description: Stack trace containing frames of this exception.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread this exception occurred in.

type.description: Exception type. One of value or exception is required, checked in StoreNormalizeProcessor

abs_path.description: Absolute path to the source file.

colno.description: Column number within the source file.

context_line.description: Source code of the current line.

data.description: Auxiliary information about the frame that is platform specific.

function.description: Name of the frame's function. This might include the name of a class.

image_addr.description: Start address of the containing code module (image).

in_app.description: Override whether this frame should be considered in-app.

instruction_addr.description: Absolute address of the frame's CPU instruction.

lang.description: The language of the frame if it overrides the stacktrace language.

lineno.description: Line number within the source file.

module.description:
Name of the module the frame is contained in.

Note that this might also include a class name if that is something the language natively considers to be part of the stack (for instance in Java).

package.description:
Name of the package that contains the frame.

For instance this can be a dylib for native languages, the name of the jar or .NET assembly.

platform.description: Which platform this frame is from.

post_context.description: Source code of the lines after the current line.

pre_context.description: Source code leading up to the current line.

raw_function.description:
A raw (but potentially truncated) function value.

If this has the same value as `function` it's best to be omitted.  This exists because on many platforms the function itself contains additional information like overload specifies or a lot of generics which can make it exceed the maximum limit we provide for the field.  In those cases then we cannot reliably trim down the function any more at a later point because the more valuable information has been removed.

The logic to be applied is that an intelligently trimmed function name should be stored in `function` and the value before trimming is stored in this field instead.  However also this field will be capped at 256 characters at the moment which often means that not the entire original value can be stored.

symbol.description:
Potentially mangled name of the symbol as it appears in an executable.

This is different from a function name by generally being the mangled name that appears natively in the binary.  This is relevant for languages like Swift, C++ or Rust.

symbol_addr.description: Start address of the frame's function.

trust.description: Used for native crashes to indicate how much we can "trust" the instruction_addr

vars.description: Local variables in a convenient format.

orig_function.description: The original function name before it was resolved.

orig_in_app.description:
The original value of the in_app flag before grouping enhancers ran.

Because we need to handle more cases the following values are used:

- missing / `null`: information not available - `-1`: in_app was set to `null` - `0`: in_app was set to `false` - `1`: in_app was set to `true`

sourcemap.description: A reference to the sourcemap used.

region.description: Human readable region name or code.

Level.description: Severity level of an event or breadcrumb.

message.description: The log message with parameter placeholders.

params.description: Positional parameters to be interpolated into the log message.

name.description: Optional name of the mach exception.

data.description: Additional attributes depending on the mechanism type.

handled.description: Flag indicating whether this exception was handled.

help_link.description: Link to online resources describing this error.

meta.description: Operating system or runtime meta information.

synthetic.description: If this is set then the exception is not a real exception but some form of synthetic error for instance from a signal handler, a hard segfault or similar where type and value are not useful for grouping or display purposes.

errno.description: Optional ISO C standard error code.

code_file.description: Path and name of the image file (required).

code_id.description:
Optional identifier of the code file.

If not specified, it is assumed to be identical to the debug identifier.

debug_file.description: Path and name of the debug companion file (required).

debug_id.description: Unique debug identifier of the image.

image_addr.description: Starting memory address of the image (required).

image_size.description: Size of the image in bytes (required).

build.description: Internal build number of the operating system.

rooted.description: Indicator if the OS is rooted (mobile mostly).

code.description: An optional signal code present on Apple systems.

code_name.description: Optional name of the errno constant.

name.description: Optional name of the errno constant.

uuid.description: UUID computed from the file contents.

registers.description: Register values of the thread (top frame).

cookies.description: URL encoded contents of the Cookie header.

data.description: Request data in any format that makes sense.

env.description: Server environment data, such as CGI/WSGI.

fragment.description: The fragment of the request URL.

inferred_content_type.description: The inferred content type of the request payload.

build.description: Application build string, if it is separate from the version.

description.description: Human readable description of a span (e.g. method URL).

parent_span_id.description: The ID of the span enclosing this span.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when the span was ended.

trace_id.description: The ID of the trace the span belongs to.

SpanStatus.description:
Trace status.

Values from https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/8fb6c14e4709e75a9aaa64b0dbbdf02a6067682a/specification/api-tracing.md#status Mapping to HTTP from https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/8fb6c14e4709e75a9aaa64b0dbbdf02a6067682a/specification/data-http.md#status

sdk_name.description: The internal name of the SDK.

version_major.description: The major version of the SDK as integer or 0.

version_minor.description: The minor version of the SDK as integer or 0.

version_patchlevel.description: The patch version of the SDK as integer or 0.

crashed.description: Indicates that this thread requested the event (usually by crashing).

current.description: Indicates that the thread was not suspended when the event was created.

id.description: Identifier of this thread within the process (usually an integer).

stacktrace.description: Stack trace containing frames of this exception.

Timestamp.description:
Can be a ISO-8601 formatted string or a unix timestamp in seconds (floating point values allowed).

Must be UTC.

parent_span_id.description: The ID of the span enclosing this span.

status.description: Whether the trace failed or succeeded. Currently only used to indicate status of individual transactions.

data.description: Additional arbitrary fields, as stored in the database (and sometimes as sent by clients). All data from `self.other` should end up here after store normalization.

geo.description: Approximate geographical location of the end user or device.

ip_address.description: Remote IP address of the user. Defaults to "{{auto}}".

name.description: Human readable name of the user.
